alert.note: Alert for Escambia Coastal; Escambia Inland; Okaloosa Coastal; Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Coastal; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued September 28 at 9:07PM EDT until September 29 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR ALL OF SOUTHEAST MISSISSIPPI, SOUTHWEST ALABAMA, AND NORTHWEST FLORIDA DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 051, 052, 053, 054, 055, 056, 057, 058, 059, 060, 067, 075, 076, 078, 079, 201, 202, 203, 204, 205, 206, 261, 262, 263, 264, 265 and 266. * WINDS...This evening northeast winds 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 to 30 mph, especially near the coast. On Thursday, northeast winds of 10 to 20 mph with gusts of 20 to 25 mph will continue. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 26 percent on Thursday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
